page.title: 05TRAFFIC PROBLEMS IN MIDHURST
page.content: The volume of road traffic passing through Midhurst causes problems.The main blocks occur where Petersfield Road enters the town and at North Mill.The narrowing of the road at the top of North Street also causes problems as does the pedestrian crossing in North Street.The crossing is controlled by demand and stops the traffic as many as 4O times an hour.The average flow of vehicles through the town in 16 hours in the winter is 11,OOO.In the summer this rises to 14,OOO. There were plans to build a by-pass around the town in 196O when the money was available.It would have gone from the Petersfield Road round the back of the Grammar School and then round Budgenor Lodge.The cost would have been Â£12m.If the plans are revived the cost will be a great deal higher.
